intro: Dicoma attenuata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisies, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapting to arid environments. Dicoma attenuata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to drought conditions.
